message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DM, cs.NA, cs.SI, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the analysis of the scaling exponent of polar codes in binary erasure channel, which is a topic related to information theory (cs.IT). The use of the Domany-Kinzel cellular automaton model of directed percolation in a tilted square lattice suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the field of discrete mathematics (cs.DM). The estimation of the scaling exponent involves numerical computations, which may fall under the category of numerical analysis (cs.NA). The paper also relies on percolation theory literature, which suggests that it may be relevant to the field of statistical inference (cs.SI). Finally, the use of the golden ratio, which is a topic related to mathematics and aesthetics, suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the field of machine learning and artificial intelligence (cs.LG).
